description: [AAI] New York -- 2025 Honorees include the Ford Foundation Mission Investments Program, set to receive the Inaugural Investor Impact Award; Hosted by Sandra Babu-BoatengSunday, September 21, 2025, 6PM - Cipriani's 42nd St. New York, NY
title: Africa: The 41st Annual AAI Awards Gala Honoring Investments in Better Futures and Visionary Minds

description: [Nile Post] Uganda has laid out an ambitious roadmap to transform its agriculture sector into a high-value, climate-resilient engine of economic growth, calling for deeper investment and collaboration from the United Kingdom and global partners.
title: Africa: Museveni Advisor, Kisanja Unveils Uganda's Ambitious Agribusiness Vision At UK-Africa Business Summit

description: [Liberian Observer] Liberia continues to strengthen its historic and strategic ties with Israel, according to H.E. Roey Gilad, Ambassador of the State of Israel to Ghana, Liberia, and Sierra Leone, during his first working visit to Monrovia since presenting his credentials nearly a year ago.
title: Africa: Liberia Among Closest Allies of Israel in Africa

description: [African Union] Addis Ababa &amp; Djibouti -- The AUC and IGAD have received with keen interest the Joint Statement issued by the Quad comprising the Foreign Ministers of Egypt, the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates, and the United States of America on the conflict in Sudan.
title: Africa: African Union Commission (AUC) and Intergovernmental Authority On Development (IGAD) Welcome the Quad Outcome On Sudan

description: [ISS] Maritime issues are on the African Union's radar, but member states must push for a shift from ambition to action.
title: Africa: With Three Bold Moves, Maritime Security in Africa Could Be Plain Sailing

description: [IPS] Addis Ababa -- As increasingly frequent droughts and devastating floods are affecting agricultural productivity, leaving millions of people food insecure in Africa amid a lack of climate finance, the African Development Bank (AfDB) has committed USD 11 billion to support various climate-resilient and infrastructure projects in rural areas.
title: Africa: AfDB Commits 11 Billion Dollars to Support Early Warning Systems, Food Security in Rural Africa

description: [Liberian Observer] The West African Institute for Financial and Economic Management (WAIFEM) has declared that gender equity is not just a question of fairness but a strategic imperative for Africa's long-term growth, innovation, and institutional resilience.
title: Africa: Gender Equity a Strategic Imperative for Africa's Growth

description: [TrustAfrica] "No Climate Justice Without Social Justice"
title: Africa: Centering Justice in Africa's Climate Future

description: [Daily Maverick] As Malawi prepares to vote, and as other countries across the continent approach elections, we must resist the distraction of inflated candidate lists. Real democracy is not about noise, it's about clarity.
title: Africa: Democracy Becomes a Numbers Game in Africa's Crowded Presidential Races

description: [This Day] Borrowing costs for governments and businesses in Nigeria, South Africa and Kenya have risen in the last five years due to policy weaknesses, unfavourable market conditions and inflation, according to a study by Moody's Ratings published yesterday.
title: Africa: Moody's - Nigeria, Other African Nations Hit By High Borrowing Costs

description: [African Arguments] Debating Ideas reflects the values and editorial ethos of the African Arguments book series, publishing engaged, often radical, scholarship, original and activist writing from within the African continent and beyond. It offers debates and engagements, contexts and controversies, and reviews and responses flowing from the African Arguments books. It is edited and managed by the International African Institute, hosted at SOAS University of London, the owners of the book series of the same name.
title: Africa: Disorder As Political Instrument - Lessons From Patrick Chabal's Scholarship for Contemporary America

description: [UN News] The United Nations has finalised the revised estimates for its 2026 proposed programme budget, outlining more than $500 million in reductions, while also introducing the first measures of the UN80 Initiative - a wider effort to make the Organisation more effective and resilient as it marks its 80th anniversary.
title: Africa: United Nations Revises 2026 Regular Budget Proposal, Pairing Cost Reductions With Initial Reform Measures

description: [UN News] "Underfunded, overstretched and under attack" is how the United Nation's top aid official has referred to the UN and the support it is providing to the humanitarian sector.
title: Africa: UN's Humanitarian Work Is 'Underfunded, Overstretched, and Under Attack'

description: [allAfrica]
title: Africa: All of Africa Today - September 16, 2025

description: [The Herald] The United Nations (UN) has called upon the African continent to establish integrated food corridors to connect different African production areas to main national and regional markets, in an effort to reduce post-harvest losses and improve food systems across the continent.
title: Africa: UN Urges Africa to Build Integrated Food Corridors to Cut Post-Harvest Losses

description: [IFJ] We mourn our fallen colleagues, we recognise the trauma carried by victim journalists and we send our heartfelt solidarity to the Palestinian Journalists Syndicate (PJS), whose members continue to report in fear and grief.
title: Africa: African Journalists Condemn the Heightened and Relentless Deadly Attacks On Journalists in Gaza

description: [Leadership] A new report by the World Bank and UNICEF has revealed that despite global progress in reducing extreme child poverty, Sub-Saharan Africa has seen no improvement in the past decade, with more than half of children in the region still living below the poverty line.
title: Africa: 'Half of Sub-Saharan African Children Still in Extreme Poverty', Say World Bank, Unicef

description: [Daba Finance] TLDR
title: Africa: Kredete Raises $22m to Expand Credit Platform for African Immigrants

description: [UN News] More than 351 million women and girls could still be living in extreme poverty by the end of the decade if current trends persist.
title: Africa: Gender Equality - UN Women Calls for Political Will and Accelerated Global Action

description: [African Arguments] Karura Forest is a 1,041 hectare urban sanctuary located in Kenya's capital, Nairobi. It serves as one of the city's largest remaining green spaces and sits in the northern part of the city, providing recreation and environmental services to millions of residents. Notably, it is one of the largest urban gazetted forests in the world.
title: Africa: Karura Forest and the Politics of Community-Based Conservation in Kenya

description: [The Conversation Africa] The relationship between inequality and economic growth is a complex one, especially in Africa. Inequality is the result of a host of factors, including policy choices, institutional legacies and power structures that favour elites. Professor Imraan Valodia, director of the Southern Centre for Inequality Studies spoke to Ernest Aryeetey, emeritus professor of Development Economics at the Institute of Statistical, Social and Economic Research, University of Ghana about the issues.
title: Africa: Inequality in Africa - What Drives It, How to End It and What Some Countries Are Getting Right

description: [IPS] Dakar -- Winnie Wambui leans forward on the panel stage, microphone in hand, scanning the room until she spots a raised hand.
title: Africa: Inside Africa's Big Bet On Youth to Feed the Continent and Who's Actually Getting Funded
